intro: Dichaelia cinerea, commonly known as the pale dichaelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Dichaelia cinerea is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
